name: 1. Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Survey Documentation
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawing is being used including the Subcontractor’s copy. Current revision to be obtained via Aconex.
Reference Documents - Drawings and drawing registers on Aconex
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Work area has been cleared and limits of works defined on site.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity

Acceptance Criteria - Details of the constituent materials used in the Polymer Modified Emulsion (PME) seal coat along with material test certificates (binder and fine aggregate) to be submitted to Contract Administrator at least 2 weeks before commencing any work.
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity

Acceptance Criteria - Jet Black, a proprietary PME seal coat surface treatment will be used. The product is to be used without any water or other substance being added to dilute the product without written approval by Contract Administrator
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to commencing any works
Acceptance Criteria - Existing and new surfaces must be thoroughly swept clean and dry prior to application. All loose material, lichen, weed growth, dust and silt must be removed.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to commencing any works

Acceptance Criteria - All fixtures and features within the extent of works are to be masked or protected by some means to prevent any contamination or discolouration. Any affected line marking will be reinstated at end of each shift, unless approved otherwise.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to commencing any works
Acceptance Criteria - Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant to inspect surface preparation prior to commencing.
Record of conformity - Aconex Correspond ence / This ITP Signed
Responsibility - Site Engineer, Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant
Frequency - Two Random test points (Pre & Post application)
Acceptance Criteria - Two random test points (Pre and Post application) will be undertaken for surface texture and Friction Testing.
○ Friction testing will be undertaken with British Pendulum swing test (AS 3661:1993) and Surface texture depth by Sand Patch Testing.
○ Results for both will be provided for information purposes only.
Record of conformity - Results for info only

Acceptance Criteria - PME seal coat to be applied by spraying using a purpose-built sprayer that incorporates a horizontally mounted paddle stirrer. Manual spreading using paint rollers may be used for minor touch ups as required.
○ Blast Pavements areas to be hand sprayed, to avoid damaging the pavement with heavy construction plant. Application rates will be included in daily record sheets.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - Application rate must be minimum of 1.0 litre/m2, unless otherwise noted on drawings. Where existing surfaces are very coarse a further application of 0.5 litres/m2 to be applied.
○ Contractor to make allowance for average application rate of 1.25 litres/m2. Where application rate is above 1.25 litre/m2, the PME must be applied in two even coats of a minimum 0.5 litres/m2.
○ Application rates will be included in daily record sheets.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Trial sections will be undertaken to agree on application rates for each surface type. Trial sections will take place in areas that are part of the main works.
Record of conformity - Aconex Correspond ence / This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - Surface treatment to be applied at minimum temperature of 15°C and rising. It is the contractor’s responsibility to decide when to stop the application allowing sufficient time (depending on weather conditions) for the material to cure.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
